Metropolitan Museum of Art

Quantitative Data

Topic
Draw in Seasons
Time
Sep 2019

Collaborating with Metropolitan Museum of Art, the goal of this project is to visualize quantitative data from MET API.

The artifects this visualization focues on are paintings collected by the MET. Hypothesizing that there might be a seasonal effect on artists, this visualization project attempts to provide a clear overview of the proportion of paintings in each seasons throughout the history.

Based on this visualization, it is easy to find that artifects about summer has shown a incresing trend, while the amount of artifects about autumn has been relatively stable.

View Github to see details.
